KERR Governor General of Governor General Australia that the Governor General may appoint such times for holding the sessions of the Parliament as he thinks fit: Now therefore I, Sir John Robert Kerr, the Governor General aforesaid, do by this my Proclamation appoint Tuesday, 17 February 1976, as the day for the Parliament of the Commonwealth to assemble for the despatch of business: And all Senators and Members of the House of Representatives are hereby required to give their attendance accordingly at Parliament House, Canberra, at 11 o'clock in the morning, on Tuesday, 17 February 1976. Given under my hand on 4 February 1976. By His Excellency's Command, Prime Minister.
